history.content: you shouldn't need 105 for 151. as long as you're comfortable with transistors and capacitors as taught by 16b you should be perfectly fine (I'm in the class right now taking the fpga lab). I can't speak for 188 and 120, but the workload of 151 is totally manageable until the project comes out, at which point I am finding myself spending upwards of 7-8 hours a day working on it, in addition to dense lecture material and homeworks.

I saw on Berkeleytime that EE 105 is recommended for EECS 151, but is it super important to take it before 151 or would I be ok without it? I'm interested in doing the FPGA lab if that makes any difference.

After this semester I will have completed all the hard pre-reqs listed (EE16A/B and CS61C) 

Also would doing 151 along with CS 188 and EE 120 along with the intro to teaching CS course (CS 370) be too much in one semester? (For reference I'm doing 170, 61C, 16B, and a breadth right now and finding it a bit time consuming but still manageable overall)

Thanks!
history.subject: How important is EE 105 for EECS 151?
